metadata.Title: CVE-2021-32627 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: Redis is an open source, in-memory database that persists on disk. Inaffected versions an integer overflow bug in Redis can be exploited tocorrupt the heap and potentially result with remote code execution. Thevulnerability involves changing the default proto-max-bulk-len andclient-query-buffer-limit configuration parameters to very large values andconstructing specially crafted very large stream elements. The problem isfixed in Redis 6.2.6, 6.0.16 and 5.0.14. For users unable to upgrade anadditional workaround to mitigate the problem without patching theredis-server executable is to prevent users from modifying theproto-max-bulk-len configuration parameter. This can be done using ACL torestrict unprivileged users from using the CONFIG SET command.

criterions.comment: redis: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
